reviews.text: Location is great and view of lake and city is nice. Staff was very friendly and parking is free though you'll always need to ring the bell to get someone to open the gates to the garage. Breakfast buffet is large but really crappy. Room is OK, generally clean, A/C could use some work. $200 is way too much for what you get, but options in Tiberias are limited.
reviews.title: Decent, but overpriced

reviews.text: The tour company picked this place. It would have been my last choice. The service in the dining room was non-existent. Want coffee? Find the coffee pot and pour it yourself because the wait staff will ignore you. Expect a clean dining room? Forget it because you will find dead cockroaches on the floor, which begs the question: what is the kitchen/food prep area like? Concerned about avian flu? Too bad because you get to sit in the dining hall and watch the swallows fly all over the room and land right on the breakfast rolls and start pecking away for their own meal. Oh, and be sure to watch where the birds sit on the curtain rods above the windows because they like to use it as a poop spot, and if they are over your head.....Not only that, they like to land on the rim of the coffee creamers and stick their beaks in the cream! Want a quiet night's rest? Forget it because the roar of the vacuum cleaner is going to waft out the open windows of the dining room at midnight for an hour and make sleep impossible! This place is disgusting and dangerous to one's health. Avoid it at all costs.
reviews.title: Outrageously disgusting

reviews.text: We stayed in the Ceasar for 4 nights. The room was hot and stuff. The carpet in the room was worn out. You have to go to the bar to use the internet at $18.00 a day. The pool closes at 5 p.m. This is when the tour groups get back and are hot and tired. The elevators are packed and slow. You are not allowed to wear you bathing suit in the lobby. This is hard when the elevators are packed and you can't get out of the bottom floor where the pool is located. The last night that we were there our tour guide and bus driver were told that they had to stay elsewhere. As the needed the room for other guests. There room had been paid for in advance. I would have rather slept on the sidewalk than in this hotel. It is rated at a 4 star. What a joke, I have stayed at motel 6 that was in better shape than this place. Stay way from here. Oh one more thing everytime you take a shower it leaks all over the floor. Like I said stay away from the Ceasar.
reviews.title: What a dump!!!!!

reviews.text: Despite that the kineret lake suffers from level drop off water,
reviews.title: Don't bother...

reviews.text: during the last years,this place is still, one of the lovely's attractions in Israel particular,
reviews.title: Better Than We Expected

reviews.text: We were on tour of Holy Land and our Tour Company booked us here.
reviews.title: Okay....good location

reviews.text: Clean, rooms nothing new or fancy but okay, first night supper good...second night not as good.... breakfast buffet was good.
reviews.title: Stay clear of this hotel!

likes.liked: — The view from the lobby balconey

reviews.title: the good thing was the atrractions outside the hotel
reviews.text: The location was good. Our room had good view of the Sea.
I would shop around if I were booking myself.
reviews.title: Tries hard, but due for a facelift

likes.liked: — Location in the heart of Galilee

reviews.title: Nice location but no private beach
reviews.text: This was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever suffered. The Hotel was expensive we paid 1200US for 4 nights and we regretted it 5 minutes after arriving at the Cesar Hotel. The location was nice but the Hotel is shabby and really showing its age, not in a good way. The staff at check in were rude and the room we received was tiny. We had our 2 older children with us and they were expected to sleep on a tiny folding out sofa bed that was rock hard. We called down to reception 4 times over 2 hours til 11:00pm begging for a cot and some pillows for the children. I went down to ask about another room and was greeted by a grumpy harrassed employee who answered 5 complaints ahead of mine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were with a tour.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: Rooms were clean, service fine but nothing outstanding.
reviews.title: The hotel is decent but a bit rundown.

reviews.text: It was very close that we could walk down to the Boardwalk, and boats were nearby so that we could easily go sailing on the Gailiee and go to many other sights as well.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: We were with a group from Georgia touring the Holy Land. We spent three nights at the Caesar in Tiberias. The food was good, the service was good, the main areas were clean. but the rooms were in need of repair. We had holes in the carpet, sloppy patchwork in the bathroom and just general neglect. This hotel need a major room refurbishment. However, the good location made up for its sins.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love Tiberias and this hotel was right where I wanted to be. Lots of history within walking distance. Yes, the place is getting old but was clean and the dining area was huge enough to handle the large number of guests. While my room was nothing great, all I used it for was sleeping.
reviews.title: 5*cleanliness,service,food,location-even if decor is old

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here. The room was decent and clean. The pool looked nice but closed early. Our first day, after sight-seeing in the heat we wanted to take a dip but were out of luck! The next day we purposely returned early to use the pool. There were pool activities, sot eh area was loud and crowded.
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok, the usual buffet. We did not opt for dinner there. We ate nearby at Decks which was decent. Our 2nd night we ate at one of the few places open (it was Shavuot), but I can't remember the name.
reviews.title: In general it was fairly good.

reviews.text: The location was good, the promenade was right there. We wanted to pay our bill the night before because we had an early start. This created all kinds of confusion at the front desk for some unknown reason (we did this at other places without any problems).
reviews.title: The Pilgrimage of a Lifetime part 2

reviews.text: In fact, it was not a bad experience at all. I could never expect so much of a hotel where we spend time during breakfast, dinner and sleep. Rooms are comfortable and decently decorated. Amenities of a very good quality and hair dryer were available.
reviews.title: adequate

reviews.text: The restaurant was OK, variety and quality were very good indeed. Waiter service followed the traditional standard of services expected in this kind of hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location, Great Views. Would return
